context: The word 'halbu' appears to be an Estonian greeting or salutation. It is likely used as a friendly hello or when meeting someone, similar to English greetings like 'hello' or 'hi'. In the examples provided, it's used in various contexts: to welcome people ('Halbu meile!' - Welcome us/hello to us!), as a general greeting ('Tere halbu!' - Hello/Good day), and as a compliment about being friendly or nice ('Sa oled väga halbu.' - You are very friendly/nice).
